Description: Conical foot sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired brown); reserved edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '359' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 754, pl. XXI, no. 754)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 405, pl. 21.2.13)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (p.25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1060) (phase 2)
